Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient reports feeling mostly okay but acknowledges experiencing ups and downs, focusing on the positives, and coping with feelings of loneliness related to family
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been trying to reach out to friends and family to cope with loneliness. They are considering joining a local club or class, such as painting, to meet new people. Sleep remains inconsistent, but they are trying to establish a routine and have started reading before bed, which helps them relax. Breathing exercises have also been beneficial in calming their mind
Mental Health Observations: The patient is aware of physical tension, specifically tight shoulders, and is actively working on relaxation techniques
Physiological Observations: The patient reports feeling more relaxed after practicing breathing exercises
Current Functional Status: The patient has been implementing strategies to improve sleep and manage anxiety, such as reading and breathing exercises
Progress Evaluation: The patient is making progress in coping strategies and is open to exploring new activities and mindfulness practices
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is willing to incorporate mindfulness practices into sessions and has shown interest in trying new techniques
Next Steps: The patient plans to sign up for a painting class, practice breathing exercises regularly, and communicate their feelings to their daughters to strengthen connections
